[h1]Multiple Properties[/h1]

To set multiple CSS properties, the [b]css[/b]() method uses JSON syntax, which is: [code format="js" ]css({"property":"value","property":"value",...});[/code]
As you can see, the syntax consists of [b]"property":"value"[/b] pairs, which are comma separated and enclosed in curly brackets { }.
[b]For Example: [/b][code format="js" codeId="1119"]$("p").css({"color": "red", "font-size": "200%"});[/code]
This will set the [b]color [/b]and [b]font-size[/b] properties of the paragraph.
[note]You can specify any number of properties using this [b]JSON [/b]syntax.[/note]
